intro: Cynanchum bisinuatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, often hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, arranged in clusters, and are pollinated by insects. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
